SUPERNOVA

The world’s largest network of leading digital animators and artists
Supernova is the first major outdoor festival of digital animation and art, initiated by Denver Digerati, Arts and Venues Denver, and the Denver Theatre District in 2016. The festival utilizes a robust network Denver Digerati has developed over five years through an ongoing series of “Friday Flash programs” that have brought advances in digital animation and motion art to a network of public LED screens situated in Denver’s downtown core as a new public art viewing experience. The program promotes the dynamic, rapidly advancing impact technology is having in art throughout the world today. Denver is the only city in the world to support a sustainable protocol that presents digital animation as public art in a meaningful and ongoing context via outdoor LED Screens.

CORE FESTIVAL ELEMENTS

  • Eight continuous hours of programming on Saturday September 22nd starting at noon, consisting of diverse and dynamic short-form digital content on our premier LED screen located at the corner of 14th and Champa and concurrently on a quality temporary LED screen located within the Denver Performing Arts Complex in the heart of downtown Denver, both with sound. An additional 3-5 screens situated throughout downtown Denver will exhibit a constant rotation of select works throughout the day without sound. Supernova will also introduce an indoor screen in 2018 situated in the lobby of the elegant Ellie Caulkins Opera House, located in the popular DPAC complex adjacent to our temporary outdoor theatre setup.
  • 90 minute Competition Screening on both the 14th and Champa LED screen as well as temporary LED screen situated within the Galleria at Denver Performing Arts Complex. Significant cash prize awards to be selected by a panel of three distinguished guest jurors chosen for their prestige within digital media on an international level.
  • Invitational program (new in 2018) taking place on our newest, dynamic two-panel screen located prominently at 16th and Arapahoe Street, featuring a $1,000 audience award for best concept.
  • Education forum featuring Juror presentations, panel discussions and dialogue with professionals associated with the festival and program screenings.
  • Preview Launch party to follow the Education Forum on Friday evening, September 21st, location TBD. Invitation only!
  • Additional indoor screenings being developed in association with the Denver Film Society at the Sie Film Center location on Colfax Ave for Thursday, September 20th, details TBD. Post-festival afternoon performance also scheduled for Sunday September 23rd for Boulder in conjunction with CU Boulder’s Black Box Theatre through the University’s Sonic Arts Program.
  • More announcements to come on additional auxilary program for 2018.
